block.p: Carrie Clark McNally, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Andrew McNally IV of Chicago, was married last evening to Claude Ricketts Maechling, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Claude B. Maechling of Oxford, Md. The Rev. Amador Garza, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the bride's parents' summer home on Wellesley Island, in the Thousand Islands region of New York.

The bride, 31, is an associate at Bell, Boyd & Lloyd, a Chicago law firm. She graduated from Duke University and received her law degree from Georgetown University. Her father retired as the chairman and chief executive of Rand McNally & Company, the map-making and publishing company in Skokie, Ill. He is now a managing director in the Chicago office of Hammond Kennedy Whitney & Company, an investment management concern. The bride is a descendant of Andrew McNally, a founder of Rand McNally.

Carrie Clark McNally, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Andrew McNally IV of Chicago, was married last evening to Claude Ricketts Maechling, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Claude B. Maechling of Oxford, Md. The Rev. Amador Garza, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the bride's parents' summer home on Wellesley Island, in the Thousand Islands region of New York.

The bride, 31, is an associate at Bell, Boyd & Lloyd, a Chicago law firm. She graduated from Duke University and received her law degree from Georgetown University. Her father retired as the chairman and chief executive of Rand McNally & Company, the map-making and publishing company in Skokie, Ill. He is now a managing director in the Chicago office of Hammond Kennedy Whitney & Company, an investment management concern. The bride is a descendant of Andrew McNally, a founder of Rand McNally.

The bridegroom, 32, is a management consultant in the Chicago office of Booz Allen & Hamilton, the consulting firm. A graduate of the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, he received a Ph.D. in chemistry from Stanford University and an M.B.A. degree from the University of Chicago. His mother, Mary Louise Maechling, is a former owner of Planned Parties, an events planning company in St. Louis. His father is the president of the Pilot Knob Ore Company, a mineral holding company in St. Louis.
